body:
Changing which entity is passed to the delete callbacks could break existing applications. This kind of change would need to be done in a minor release where we could document the behavior change.

edit: clarify my hasty response.
When you call `$this->Topics->save()` are the junction entities you're passing in of the correct type? Or is the ORM fetching the incorrect entities inside the BelongsToMany association?

When saving it's using the standard `relationship._ids` form helper to save Groupings entities. In this case yes, the _joinData on belongsToMany relationship is of correct entity type.

In case of removal the "original" attribute on the topic entity right after patching does contain the correct entity in _joinData, if that's what you are asking by junction entitles.

```
App\Model\Entity\Topic Object
(
[id] => 18
...
[[original]] => Array
        (
            [groupings] => Array
                (
                    [0] => App\Model\Entity\Grouping Object
                        (
                            [id] => 7
                           ...
                            [_joinData] => App\Model\Entity\GroupTopic Object
                                (
                                    [id] => 8
                                    [group_id] => 7
                                    [topic_id] => 18
```

I believe it's the later, when deleting BelongsToMany fetches correct data however applies incorrect entity type to that data.

issue.title: Fix belongstomany delete callbacks getting wrong entity type

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Previously the query used would have the target table as the root table, and *join* the junction table. This would cause the junction table entities to use the target table entity class.

Now the junction table is used as the root and the association target is joined on. I've also removed the column subsetting so that entities passed to callbacks include their complete property sets.

Targeting this for 4.3 as the change in behavior while more correct could cause problems for applications.

Fixes #15977

issue.title: belongsToMany through table with finder that contains table fails

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.title: Fix belongsToMany with finder & contain

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
When a belongsToMany association uses a finder, and that finder applies a contain() the query will fail as the query is rooted in the junction table and not the association target table. This was caused by the
changes done in #15977 to fix the wrong entity type being passed to delete callbacks.

Restoring the old query fixes this issue, but would break entity delete callbacks. To solve that I've selected all the fields on the junction table and then created the correct entity. This is a bit gross, but trying to use `contain()` on the junction association doesn't work as the table has already been `innerJoinWith()` onto the query. I also attempted to use subqueries and `where exists` but abandoned that as it caused other problems in type mapping parameters.

Fixes #16252
